page.title: 07FARMING CHANGES
page.content: {Mechanization}has been the most noticeable change resulting in less manpower,larger units,more produce and livestock per acre and{intensification dairy or sheep.{Holding 40 years ago} a family farm 15-20 acres,6-12 milking cows,3-4 sows,20-80chickens,6-20sheep Winter forage was hay cut and harvested by hand and horse.Muck spreading was done manually.{Holding {today}One occupant-mainly sheep and cattle 50-300 sheep,10-30 suckling cows or 40-80 head of beef.Forage still hay with silage on the bigger farms.Acreage 80-130 acres Holdings today could be made up of 4-8 smaller holdings. For every full time farmer there are 4-5 part time farmers.There are four times the number of horses today used for riding.
